chapter.title: Introduction
chapter.para: In January 2005 I wrote the first version of freeVikings, and, very proud of my first game (it was funless, boring, often crashing), published it on the Internet. A lot has changed since January 2005. I'm not so proud of my first game. And, I think, it's never more funless.

FreeVikings now have several fancy features you expect a good game to have. It's usually stable, good-looking
This is a joke. Actually, freeVikings are still awful. I'm not able to do anything with this. and extendable.

When the developers make their application scriptable, they don't usually do it for themselves but for the users. Or they say they are doing it for users (everybody knows that the software developers only do things for fun). FreeVikings are scriptable. It means... Yes, you're right. Actually it means I was playing with Ruby. But forget it, will you? It means I want to give you the possibility of extending freeVikings with your own levels. You can catch Erik, Baleog and Olaf into your own traps. It seems good, doesn't it?
So if you like freeVikings, have just a small amount of time for playing around a bit, ... Go on reading and make the best freeVikings level ever seen.

chapter.title: First map
chapter.para: This chapter will guide you through the first steps of the freeVikings level developer. You will start with clean hands and end with a ready to use map.

section.title: Requirements
section.para: What will you need? Well, it's onto you. Actually you don't need nearly anything. Just a well-running freeVikings installation and a plain text editor. But I would recommend you some better stuff. You should try to use a bit more sophisticated text editor such as Emacs, vim or SciTE. Why? Because of the syntax highlighting and checking. It's very helpful. Scripting mainly consists of XML and Ruby source editing. (Don't be afraid, it's simple.)

section.title: Writing XML
section.para: Let's start writing. Make yourself a directory you will store your freeVikings map in. Open a file with suffic .xml, e.g. proto.xml.
Every XML file must start with a XML declaration.
Then the document type definition usually goes, but freeVikings maps have no DTD yet, so we'll omit it.
I hope you know HTML. XML looks very similar. Just tags... FreeVikings map is a XML file with special tags.
